bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to A. Diaz Albertini, January 28, 1942

div1.p: Hench inquires about Hoffman and Ponce.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to A. Diaz Albertini, January 28, 1942
div1.opener:
January 28, 1942
Dr. A. D. Albertini
Director, The Finlay Institute
Habana, Cuba
My dear Doctor Albertini:
div1.p:
You remember that I wrote you a few weeks
ago asking whether Professor W. H. Hoffmann was associated
with the Finlay Institute. He has requested quite a number
of reprints of one of my articles on yellow fever and I
do not wish to give that many out unless I know that he
is truly a member of the Finlay Institute.
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
P.S. Since writing the above I have also had
a letter from Dr. Felipe Carbonell Ponce, who has become
interested in our project to memorialize Camp Lazear and he
apparently has gone so far as to interest Mr. Salas, a radio
man, and has taken the matter up with President Batista and
Dr. Marruz. I would appreciate it very much if you could tell
me something of Dr. Ponce. I am anxious to have your confi-
dential information that he is the disinterested sort of a
physician whom we would want involved in a memorial to Dr.
Finlay and the American Yellow Fever Board. I will appreciate
greatly having a confidential note from you at your earliest
convenience, advising me whether I should send Dr. Hoffmann
the hundred reprints that he requests and also continue corres-
pondence with Dr. Ponce.
P.S.H.
